New Records: Samson hit the second-fastest T20I century by an Indian with a 111 off 40 balls
India scored the second-highest T20I total of 297, behind Nepal's 314
Key Match Events: Explosive batting display by Samson and Suryakumar Yadav with a 173-run partnership
Bangladesh collapsed in the chase with a 133-run loss
Riyan Parag and Hardik Pandya contributed significantly after the fall of wickets
Post-Match Reflections: India completed a 3-0 sweep of the T20I leg and a 2-0 win in Tests earlier
Bangladesh struggled across all three T20Is
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium in front of 24,000 spectators
India's highest T20I score was 260 against Sri Lanka in 2017
